oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Garrison cap
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This common type of U.S. Army overseas or garrison cap has two hand-sewn repairs on upper left fold with some scattered mothing and wear. These simple cloth caps replaced the campaign hat as every day wear while American soliders were deployed in Europe. Several different patterns were used, but this one appears to have been the most widely issued.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
